bugs.title: CVE-2024-9957 chromium: Use after free in UI [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-9957 chromium: Use after free in UI [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-9957 chromium-browser: Use after free in UI

long_desc.thetext:
An use after free flaw was found in the UI component of the Chromium browser.

Upstream bug(s):

https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=358151317

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2318988

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

FEDORA-2024-c0b1d26de3 (chromium-130.0.6723.58-1.fc39) has been submitted as an update to Fedora 39.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-c0b1d26de3

FEDORA-EPEL-2024-dde512d4ed (chromium-130.0.6723.58-1.el8) has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 8.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2024-dde512d4ed

FEDORA-EPEL-2024-01e1cef110 (chromium-130.0.6723.58-1.el9) has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 9.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2024-01e1cef110

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-3a6f9ab958

If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2024-dde512d4ed

bugs.title: CVE-2024-9959 chromium: Use after free in DevTools [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-9959 chromium: Use after free in DevTools [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-9959 chromium-browser: Use after free in DevTools

long_desc.thetext: Use after free in DevTools in Google Chrome prior to 130.0.6723.58 allowed a remote attacker who had compromised the renderer process to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted Chrome Extension. (Chromium security severity: Medium)

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2318970

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

bugs.title: CVE-2024-9963 chromium: Insufficient data validation in Downloads [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-9963 chromium: Insufficient data validation in Downloads [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-9963 chromium-browser: Insufficient data validation in Downloads

long_desc.thetext: Insufficient data validation in Downloads in Google Chrome prior to 130.0.6723.58 allowed a remote attacker who convinced a user to engage in specific UI gestures to perform UI spoofing via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: Medium)

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2318971

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

long_desc.thetext: Inappropriate implementation in Permissions in Google Chrome prior to 130.0.6723.58 allowed a remote attacker who convinced a user to engage in specific UI gestures to perform UI spoofing via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: Medium)

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2318969

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

FEDORA-2024-c0b1d26de3 (chromium-130.0.6723.58-1.fc39) has been submitted as an update to Fedora 39.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-c0b1d26de3

If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

bugs.title: CVE-2024-9960 chromium: Use after free in Dawn [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-9960 chromium: Use after free in Dawn [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-9960 chromium-browser: Use after free in Dawn

long_desc.thetext: Use after free in Dawn in Google Chrome prior to 130.0.6723.58 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: Medium)

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2318966

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.
